value: aava_1.0_score
description

The two metadata versions represent the same conceptual workflow model with significant structural evolution. AAVA 2.0 introduces enhanced organization and normalization while preserving core semantic meaning. Major structural changes include workflow metadata reorganization and agent definition improvements.
Core workflow concept preserved: Both versions define a 3-agent data integration workflow (DI_DataSpecs_Modelupdates_SN) with identical functional purposes.
Agent semantic alignment: All three agents (Technical Specification, Delta Model Changes, Functional Test Cases) maintain identical business purposes and core functionality descriptions.
Task descriptions show 100% content preservation across versions with identical business logic and requirements.
Major structural reorganization: AAVA 1.0 uses flat 'nodes' array vs AAVA 2.0's hierarchical 'workFlowDetail' + 'workflowAgents' structure.
Workflow metadata enhancement: AAVA 2.0 introduces dedicated workFlowDetail object with explicit id (2147) and name fields for better governance.
Agent definition normalization: AAVA 2.0 replaces 'agentName' with structured 'agentId' + 'name' approach for better referential integrity.
Tools reference evolution: AAVA 1.0 'tools' array replaced with 'toolReferences' array in AAVA 2.0 for improved tool management.
Workflow identifier change: 'workflowId' (1594) renamed to 'workFlowDetail.id' (2147) with value update indicating version progression.
Workflow name normalization: 'workflowName' field moved to 'workFlowDetail.name' with formatting change from underscore to space separation.
Agent identification enhancement: 'agentName' replaced with 'agentId' + 'name' structure providing unique numeric identifiers (3885, 3474, 3545).
Model specification evolution: 'model' field replaced with 'modelDeploymentName' showing version progression (gpt-4 to gpt-4.1).
Agent array restructuring: Root-level 'nodes' array renamed to 'workflowAgents' with enhanced metadata structure.
Tools reference modernization: Simple 'tools' string array evolved to 'toolReferences' empty array structure for future extensibility.
Task structure flattening: AAVA 1.0 nested 'task' object with 'description' and 'expectedOutput' flattened to direct 'description' field in AAVA 2.0.
Expected output specifications removed: AAVA 2.0 eliminates detailed 'expectedOutput' metadata present in AAVA 1.0, reducing documentation completeness.
Tool definitions absent: AAVA 2.0 shows empty 'toolReferences' arrays where AAVA 1.0 specified 'DI_Github_File_Writer_Z' tool.
Metadata completeness degradation: Loss of expectedOutput specifications reduces governance and validation capabilities.
Tool reference gaps: Empty toolReferences arrays may impact workflow execution and dependency tracking.
Version progression indicators: Workflow ID increment (1594→2147) and model version advancement (gpt-4→gpt-4.1) suggest systematic evolution.
Structural modernization: Hierarchical organization in AAVA 2.0 improves metadata governance and referential integrity.
Backward compatibility concerns: Structural changes may impact existing systems expecting AAVA 1.0 flat 'nodes' array format.
Tool execution gaps: Missing tool specifications in AAVA 2.0 may cause workflow execution failures.
Validation capability reduction: Absence of expectedOutput metadata limits automated validation and quality assurance.
AAVA 1.0 JSON syntax validation: Perfect JSON structure with consistent object hierarchy and proper array formatting.
Internal consistency check: All agent references, task structures, and metadata fields maintain logical coherence throughout the document.
AAVA 2.0 JSON syntax validation: Well-formed JSON with enhanced structural organization and proper nested object formatting.
Referential integrity: Agent IDs, workflow details, and model deployment names maintain consistent internal references.
Content preservation excellence: Despite structural changes, all critical business logic, task descriptions, and functional requirements remain identical.
Modernization benefits: AAVA 2.0 introduces improved metadata organization, unique identifiers, and hierarchical structure for better governance.
Evolution trade-offs: Structural improvements come at cost of some metadata completeness and potential backward compatibility challenges.
